element.label: Input Name
element.name: name
element.key: Name of this IBM Websphere Datapower statistics input. (NO SPACES ALLOWED)

element.name: device_details
element.key: Datapower Device Details

element.label: Datapower Device Name
element.name: device_name
element.key: The Datapower device to gather statistics for.

element.label: Datapower Device Host name or IP
element.name: device_host
element.key: The Datapower device host name or IP.

element.label: SOMA Port.
element.name: soma_port
element.key: The XML Management interface port. Defaults to 5550.

element.label: SOMA User
element.name: soma_user
element.key: The user to use for the XML management interface.

element.label: SOMA User password.
element.name: soma_user_password
element.key: The user's password for the XML management interface.

element.name: polling_details
element.key: Polling

element.label: Interval
element.name: dpinput_interval
element.key: How often to run the Datapower input script(in seconds). Defaults to 60 seconds.

element.label: CPU Usage Interval
element.name: cpu_usage_int
element.key: How often to capture CPU usage statistics. Defaults to 60 seconds.

element.label: Connections Accepted Interval
element.name: conns_accepted_int
element.key: How often to capture connections accepted statistics. Defaults to 60 seconds.

element.label: Memory Usage Interval
element.name: memory_int
element.key: How often to capture memory, domains memory and service memory statistics. Defaults to 300 seconds.

element.label: Network Transmit and Receive Kbps Interval
element.name: tx_rx_kbps_thruput_int
element.key: How often to capture network transmit and receive kbps throughput statistics. Defaults to 60 seconds.

element.label: Network Statistics Interval
element.name: network_int
element.key: How often to capture TCP network and ethernet interface statistics. Defaults to 300 seconds.

element.label: System Usage Interval
element.name: system_usage_int
element.key: How often to capture System Usage statistics. Defaults to 60 seconds.

element.name: statistics_to_capture
element.key: Statistics

element.label: Enable statistics.
element.name: enable_stats
element.key: Enable statistics. Will be enabled in all domains.

element.label: Enable statistics in domains.
element.name: enable_stats_domains
element.key: Enable statistics in the listed domains. Comma separated. Empty will be enable in all domains.

element.label: Ethernet interfaces with IP addresses only.
element.name: only_eth_ints_with_ips
element.key: Capture statistics for ethernet interfaces with IP addresses only.

element.label: Object Status.
element.name: object_status
element.key: Capture object status. Will capture object status per domain.

element.label: Object status interval
element.name: object_status_int
element.key: How often to capture object status output. Defaults to 900 seconds.

element.label: HTTP Status.
element.name: http_status
element.key: Capture HTTP statistics. Will capture statistics for all domains.

element.label: HTTP status interval
element.name: http_int
element.key: How often to capture HTTP statistics. Defaults to 60 seconds.

element.label: Service Memory Status.
element.name: service_memory_status
element.key: Capture service memory statistics. Will capture statistics for all domains. Memory usage interval is used.

element.label: SQL Status.
element.name: sql_status
element.key: Capture SQL related statistics. Will capture statistics for all domains.

element.label: SQL Status Interval
element.name: sql_int
element.key: How often to capture System Usage statistics. Defaults to 300 seconds.

element.label: MQ Status.
element.name: mq_status
element.key: Capture MQ related statistics. Will capture statistics for all domains.

element.label: MQ Status Interval
element.name: mq_int
element.key: How often to capture MQ statistics. Defaults to 300 seconds.

element.label: Hardware and Sensor Status.
element.name: sensors_status
element.key: Capture hardware and sensor statistics.

element.label: Hardware and Sensor status Interval
element.name: sensors_int
element.key: How often to capture Hardware and sensor statistics. Defaults to 300 seconds.

element.label: XSLT Status.
element.name: xslt_status
element.key: Capture stylesheet related statistics. Will capture statistics for all domains.

element.label: XSLT and XML status Interval
element.name: xslt_int
element.key: How often to capture stylesheet related statistics. Defaults to 600 seconds.

element.label: Web service operation Status.
element.name: ws_op_status
element.key: Capture web service operation statistics. Will capture statistics for all domains.

element.label: Web service operation Status Interval
element.name: ws_op_status_int
element.key: How often to capture Web service operation statistics. Defaults to 300 seconds.

element.label: Web Application Firewall Statistics.
element.name: web_app_fw_stats
element.key: Capture WebAppFw accepted and rejected statistics. Will capture statistics for all domains.

element.label: Web Application Firewall Statistics Interval
element.name: web_app_fw_int
element.key: How often to capture Web Application Firewall Statistics. Defaults to 300 seconds.

element.name: wsm_status
element.key: WS-M

element.label: Use WS-M.
element.name: use_wsm
element.key: Use WS-M to capture transaction related statistics and message payloads.

element.label: WSM Statistics Interval
element.name: wsm_stats_int
element.key: How often to capture WSM Agent and Spooler Statistics. Defaults to 300 seconds.

element.label: Enable the WS-M agents.
element.name: enable_wsm
element.key: Enable the WS-M agents on the device.

element.label: Domains in which to use WS-M.
element.name: wsm_domains
element.key: Which domains to enable and use WS-M in. Comma separated list or empty for all domains.

element.label: Use WS-M transaction time as event time.
element.name: use_wsm_transaction_time
element.key: Use WS-M transaction time as event time

element.label: WS-M maximum record size.
element.name: wsm_max_rec_size
element.key: Maximum record size for WS-M buffer. Defaults to 3000.

element.label: WS-M maximum memory.
element.name: wsm_max_mem
element.key: Maximum memory to use for WS-M buffer. In KB. Defaults to 64000 (64MB).

element.label: WS-M capture mode.
element.name: wsm_capture_mode
element.key: WS-M capture mode. Defaults to faults only.

element.label: WS-M buffering mode.
element.name: wsm_buf_mode
element.key: WS-M buffering mode. Defaults to discard.

element.label: WS-M Mediation enforcement metrics.
element.name: wsm_med_enf_metrics
element.key: Capture mediation enforcement metrics.

element.name: wsm_pull_settings
element.key: WS-M Pull Subscription Settings

element.label: WS-M Pull subscription.
element.name: wsm_pull
element.key: Pull the WS-M data from the device.

element.label: WS-M pull interval.
element.name: wsm_pull_interval
element.key: Pull interval. Defaults to 60 seconds.

element.label: WS-M pull maximum SOAP Envelope size.
element.name: wsm_pull_max_soap_env_size
element.key: WS-M Pull maximum SOAP Envelope size. Defaults to 51200.

element.label: WS-M pull maximum number of elements.
element.name: wsm_pull_max_elements
element.key: WS-M Pull maximum number of elements. Defaults to 10.

element.label: Use the custom Splunk WS-M custom formatter.
element.name: wsm_pull_use_custom_formatter
element.key: Use the custom Splunk WSM formatter to format the WSM data on the device.

element.name: wsm_push_settings
element.key: WS-M Push Subscription Settings

element.label: WS-M Push subscription.
element.name: wsm_push
element.key: Push the data from the device to Splunk

element.label: WS-M push server host.
element.name: wsm_push_server_host
element.key: Push server host.

element.label: WS-M push server port.
element.name: wsm_push_server_port
element.key: Push server port. Defaults to 14014

element.label: WS-M Push server thread per domain.
element.name: wsm_push_server_thread_per_domain
element.key: Start a WS-M Push server thread per domain.

element.label: WS-M push maximum number of elements.
element.name: wsm_push_max_elements
element.key: WS-M Push maximum number of elements.

element.name: wsm_payload_settings
element.key: WS-M Message Payload Settings

element.label: Write WS-M Message Payloads to disk.
element.name: wsm_msg_payloads_to_disk
element.key: Write the WS-M message payloads to disk instead of indexing in Splunk.

element.label: Folder to which to write message payloads.
element.name: wsm_msg_payloads_folder
element.key: The folder to which to write the message payloads. Defaults to /opt/splunk/wsm_msgs

element.label: Use MongoDB to store the message payloads.
element.name: wsm_msg_payloads_use_mongodb
element.key: Use a MongoDB to store the message payloads instead of individual files.

element.label: MondoDB database name.
element.name: wsm_msg_payloads_mongodb_db_name
element.key: The MongoDB database name. Defaults to "dptrans".

element.label: MondoDB database host
element.name: wsm_msg_payloads_mongodb_host
element.key: The MongoDB database host. Defaults to 127.0.0.1.

element.label: MondoDB database port
element.name: wsm_msg_payloads_mongodb_port
element.key: The MongoDB database port. Defaults to 27017.

element.label: MondoDB database use auth.
element.name: wsm_msg_payloads_mongodb_use_auth
element.key: Use MongoDB Authentication. Defaults to false.

element.label: MondoDB database user
element.name: wsm_msg_payloads_mongodb_user
element.key: The MongoDB database user. Defaults to splunk.

element.label: MondoDB database password
element.name: wsm_msg_payloads_mongodb_password
element.key: The MongoDB database password.
